It's a scam basically, and violates the YT terms of service. Just warning.

If you get a message,

It's a scam basically, and violates the YT terms of service. Just warning.

I'll be careful of these messages.
Never trust them. I always look at their channel first and see if they have any videos at all. They normally have none.
If someone you don't trust send you any unprecise message like this one with a link for 'tips' or "tricks' to do something, it is rare that the link will be something else than scam
It's worse when it's...Nigerian prince scam mail.

Never trust them. I always look at their channel first and see if they have any videos at all. They normally have none.

I did the exact same thing.

I got that Nigerian "Heir to the throne and millions of dollars" email and those messages on youtube(Got the youtube messages when i had like 2 videos that was like nothing) So i laughed and continued watching stuff.
Just assume everything you get in your inbox is a scam I got this a year ago.

even more reason to be careful of youtube (or indeed any) links: there's now trojans that can be spread through youtube videos, embedded into the stream.

Maybe Adobe has fixed the security hole that allowed it, maybe not yet.

I've had this before, and countless other garbage like invites from would be musicians and filmmakers.

If someone can't recognise spam or scam right away, they're only gonna learn from the mistakes they get into.

I've had this message multiple times, make sure you don't click the link they're sending you.

It's always the same message, mine were coming from China...

Never trust anything that says, ''we can give you this, or that, views, or money!''

YouGoogleTube.

Security so weak, spam mail gets through it.

If something is free on the internet there are two scenarios:

a) It's a scam

You're the product, not the customer.
Another reason to hate people in general!
